Topic: Draw a fish in their habitat with labels.
CAN: Draw a basic shape that resembles a fish, possibly without details or accuracy. (basic representation)
Attempt to label the fish or parts of it with unclear or incorrect labels (e.g., 'fish' on the body).
Inconsistently label a few elements of the drawing, showing some attempt at understanding.
CANNOT: Draw and accurately label the fish in its natural water habitat (e.g., forgets to include water or labels it incorrectly).
Label or represent other plants or animals accurately in the habitat (e.g., draws random animals not typical of the habitat).
Identify and label essential needs such as water, air, and food resources in the drawing (e.g., omits labels like 'water' or 'food').
Represent the relationship between the fish and the water it needs to survive (e.g., shows no connection between the fish and its environment).
Label the resources the habitat provides to the fish (e.g., misunderstands or omits resources like plants providing oxygen).
Identify and label how the fish and resources work together as part of a system (e.g., thinks the fish can survive without water).
